metadata.title: High-Throughput Screening to Identify Plant Derived Human LDH-A Inhibitors NIH Public Access

abstract.original_text: Aims-Lactate dehydrogenase (LDH)-A is highly expressed in diverse human malignant tumors, parallel to aggressive metastatic disease, resistance to radiation/chemotherapy and clinically poor outcome. Although this enzyme constitutes a plausible target in treatment of advanced cancer, there are few known LDH-A inhibitors.

sentences.segment_text: Aims-Lactate dehydrogenase ( LDH ) - A is highly expressed in diverse human malignant tumors ,
resistance to radiation/chemotherapy and clinically poor outcome .
Although this enzyme constitutes a plausible target in treatment of advanced cancer ,
there are few known LDH-A inhibitors .

abstract.original_text: Study Design-In this work, we utilized a high-throughput enzyme micro-array format to screen and evaluate > 900 commonly used medicinal plant extracts (0.00001-.5 mg/ml) for capacity to inhibit activity of recombinant full length human LDHA; EC .1.1.1.27.

sentences.segment_text: Study Design-In this work , we utilized a high-throughput enzyme micro-array format to screen and evaluate > 900 commonly used medicinal plant extracts ( 0.00001-.5 mg/ml ) for capacity to inhibit activity of recombinant full length human LDHA ; EC .1.1.1.27 .

abstract.original_text: Methodology-The protein sequence of purified enzyme was confirmed using 1D gel electrophoresis-MALDI-TOF-MS/MS, enzyme activity was validated by oxidation of NADH (500μM) and kinetic inhibition established in the presence of a known inhibitor (Oxalic Acid).

sentences.segment_text: Methodology-The protein sequence of purified enzyme was confirmed using 1D gel electrophoresis-MALDI-TOF-MS / MS ,
enzyme activity was validated by oxidation of NADH ( 500μM ) and kinetic inhibition established in the presence of a known inhibitor ( Oxalic Acid ) .

abstract.original_text: the natural extracts tested, the lowest IC 50 s [<0.001 mg/ml] were obtained by: Chinese Gallnut (Melaphis chinensis gallnut), Bladderwrack (Fucus vesiculosus), Kelp (Laminaria Japonica) and Babul (Acacia Arabica). Forty-six additional herbs contained significant LDH-A inhibitory properties with IC 50 s [<0.07 mg/ml], some of which have common names of Arjun, Pipsissewa, Cinnamon, Pink Rose Buds/Petals, Wintergreen, Cat's Claw, Witch Hazel Root and Rhodiola Root.

sentences.segment_text: the natural extracts tested , the lowest IC 50 s ( < 0.001 mg/ml ) were obtained by : Chinese Gallnut ( Melaphis chinensis gallnut ) ,
Kelp ( Laminaria Japonica ) and Babul ( Acacia Arabica ) .
Forty-six additional herbs contained significant LDH-A inhibitory properties with IC 50 s ( < 0.07 mg/ml ) ,
some of which have common names of Arjun ,
Witch Hazel Root and Rhodiola Root .

abstract.original_text: Conclusion-These findings reflect relative potency by rank of commonly used herbs and plants that contain human LDH-A inhibitory properties. Future research will be required to isolate chemical constituents within these plants responsible for LDH-A inhibition and investigate potential therapeutic application.

Future research will be required to isolate chemical constituents within these plants responsible for LDH-A inhibition and investigate potential therapeutic application .
